Structs/SSLSettings.html#/s:11MongoKitte.name: invalidHostNameAllowed
Structs/SSLSettings.html#/s:11MongoKitte.abstract: Invalid host names should be allowed. Defaults to false. Take care before setting this to true, as it makes the application susceptible to man-in-the-middle attacks.

Structs/SSLSettings.html#/s:11MongoKitte.name: invalidCertificateAllowed
Structs/SSLSettings.html#/s:11MongoKitte.abstract: Invalis certificate should be allowed. Defaults to false. Take care before setting this to true, as it makes the application susceptible to man-in-the-middle attacks.

Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.name: makePrimitive()
Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.abstract: Allows embedding this stage inside another Document

Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.name: makeDocument()
Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.abstract: The Document that this stage consists of

Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.name: init(_:)
Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.abstract: Create a stage from a Document

Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.name: project(_:)
Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.abstract: A projection stage passes only the projected fields to the next stage.

Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.name: match(_:)
Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.abstract: A match stage only passed the documents that match the query to the next stage

Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.name: match(_:)
Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.abstract: A match stage only passed the documents that match the query to the next stage

Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.name: sample(sizeOf:)
Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.abstract: Takes a sample with the size of size. These randomly selected Documents will be passed to the next stage.

Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.name: skip(_:)
Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.abstract: This will skip the specified number of input Documents and leave them out. The rest will be passed to the next stage.

Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.name: limit(_:)
Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.abstract: This will limit the results to the specified number.

Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.name: sort(_:)
Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.abstract: Sorts the input Documents by the specified Sort object and passed them in the newly sorted order to the next stage.

Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.name: group(groupDocument:)
Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.abstract: Groups the input Documents by the specified expression and outputs a Document to the next stage for each distinct grouping.

Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.name: group(_:computed:)
Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.abstract: Groups the input Documents by the specified expression and outputs a Document to the next stage for each distinct grouping.

Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.name: unwind(_:includeArrayIndex:preserveNullAndEmptyArrays:)
Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.abstract: Deconstructs an Array at the given path (key).

Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.name: lookup(from:localField:foreignField:as:)
Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.abstract: Performs a left outer join to an unsharded collection in the same database

Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.name: lookup(from:localField:foreignField:as:)
Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.abstract: Performs a left outer join to an unsharded collection in the same database

Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.name: out(to:)
Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.abstract: Writes the resulting Documents to the provided Collection

Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.name: out(to:)
Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.abstract: Writes the resulting Documents to the provided Collection

Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.name: facet(_:)
Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.abstract: Takes the input Documents and passes them through multiple Aggregation Pipelines. Every pipeline result will be placed at the provided key.

Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.name: count(insertedAtKey:)
Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.abstract: Counts the amounts of Documents that have been inputted. Places the result at the provided key.

Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.name: replaceRoot(withExpression:)
Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.abstract: Takes an embedded Document resulting from the provided expression and replaces the entire Document with this result.

Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.name: addFields(_:)
Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.abstract: Adds fields to the inputted Documents and sends these new Documents to the next stage.

Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.name: geoNear(options:)
Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html#/.abstract: Runs a geospatial query on the inputted Documents

Structs/AggregationPipeline.html#/s:11Mo.name: pipelineDocument
Structs/AggregationPipeline.html#/s:11Mo.abstract: The resulting Document that can be modified by the user.

Structs/AggregationPipeline.html#/s:11Mo.name: makePrimitive()
Structs/AggregationPipeline.html#/s:11Mo.abstract: Allows embedding this pipeline inside another Document

Structs/AggregationPipeline.html#/s:11Mo.name: init(arrayLiteral:)
Structs/AggregationPipeline.html#/s:11Mo.abstract: You can easily and naturally create an aggregate by providing a variadic list of stages.

Structs/AggregationPipeline.html#/s:11Mo.abstract: You can easily and naturally create an aggregate by providing an array of stages.

Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html.name: Stage
Structs/AggregationPipeline/Stage.html.abstract: A Pipeline stage. Pipelines pass their data of the collection through every stage. The last stage defines the output.

Structs/DBRef.html#/s:11MongoKitten5DBRe.abstract: The collection this referenced Document resides in

Structs/DBRef.html#/s:11MongoKitten5DBRe.abstract: Converts this DBRef to a BSON.Primitive for easy embedding

Structs/QueryFlags.html#/s:11MongoKitten.name: init(rawValue:)
Structs/QueryFlags.html#/s:11MongoKitten.abstract: You can initialize this with an Int32 and compare the number with an array of QueryFlags

Structs/GeoNearOptions.html#/s:11MongoKi.name: distanceField
Structs/GeoNearOptions.html#/s:11MongoKi.abstract: The output field that contains the calculated distance.

Structs/GeoNearOptions.html#/s:11MongoKi.name: spherical
Structs/GeoNearOptions.html#/s:11MongoKi.abstract: If true, then MongoDB uses spherical geometry to calculate distances in meters if the specified (near) point is a GeoJSON point and in radians if the specified (near) point is a legacy coordinate pair.

Structs/GeoNearOptions.html#/s:11MongoKi.name: minDistance
Structs/GeoNearOptions.html#/s:11MongoKi.abstract: The minimum distance from the center point resulting Documents must be

Structs/GeoNearOptions.html#/s:11MongoKi.name: maxDistance
Structs/GeoNearOptions.html#/s:11MongoKi.abstract: The maximum distance from the center point resulting Documents must be

Structs/GeoNearOptions.html#/s:11MongoKi.name: query
Structs/GeoNearOptions.html#/s:11MongoKi.abstract: Requires resulting documents to also match this query, besides the geolocation query

Structs/GeoNearOptions.html#/s:11MongoKi.name: distanceMultiplier
Structs/GeoNearOptions.html#/s:11MongoKi.abstract: The factor to multiply all distances returned by the query. For example, use the distanceMultiplier to convert radians, as returned by a spherical query, to kilometers by multiplying by the radius of the Earth.

Structs/GeoNearOptions.html#/s:11MongoKi.name: uniqueDocs
Structs/GeoNearOptions.html#/s:11MongoKi.abstract: Outputs each matching document once, even if multiple fields match the query

Structs/GeoNearOptions.html#/s:11MongoKi.name: includeLocs
Structs/GeoNearOptions.html#/s:11MongoKi.abstract: This specifies the output field that identifies the location used to calculate the distance.

Structs/Collation/Strength.html#/s:11Mon.name: primary
Structs/Collation/Strength.html#/s:11Mon.abstract: 1: Performs comparisons of the base characters only, ignoring other differences such as diacritics and case

Structs/Collation/Strength.html#/s:11Mon.name: secondary
Structs/Collation/Strength.html#/s:11Mon.abstract: 2: Performs comparisons up to secondary differences, such as diacritics.

Structs/Collation/Strength.html#/s:11Mon.name: tertiary
Structs/Collation/Strength.html#/s:11Mon.abstract: 3 (default): Performs comparisons up to tertiary differences, such as case and letter variants.

Structs/Collation/Strength.html#/s:11Mon.name: quaternary
Structs/Collation/Strength.html#/s:11Mon.abstract: 4: Same as 3, but requires proper punctuation or for comparing japanese text

Structs/Collation/Alternate.html#/s:11Mo.name: nonIgnorable
Structs/Collation/Alternate.html#/s:11Mo.abstract: Whitespace and punctuation are considered base characters.

Structs/Collation/Alternate.html#/s:11Mo.name: shifted
Structs/Collation/Alternate.html#/s:11Mo.abstract: Whitespace and punctuation are not considered base characters and are only distinguished at strength levels greater than 3.

Structs/Collation/IgnorableCharacters.ht.name: punct
Structs/Collation/IgnorableCharacters.ht.abstract: Both whitespaces and punctuation are “ignorable”, i.e. not considered base characters.

Structs/Collation/IgnorableCharacters.ht.name: space
Structs/Collation/IgnorableCharacters.ht.abstract: Whitespace are “ignorable”, i.e. not considered base characters.

Structs/Collation.html#/s:11MongoKitten9.name: makePrimitive()
Structs/Collation.html#/s:11MongoKitten9.abstract: Converts this Collation to a BSONPrimtive so it can be embedded

Structs/Collation/IgnorableCharacters.ht.name: IgnorableCharacters
Structs/Collation/IgnorableCharacters.ht.abstract: Determines up to which characters are considered ignorable when alternate: shifted.

Structs/Collation/Alternate.html.name: Alternate
Structs/Collation/Alternate.html.abstract: Determines whether collation should consider whitespace and punctuation as base characters for purposes of comparison.

Structs/BuildInfo.html#/s:11MongoKitten9.name: storageEngines
Structs/BuildInfo.html#/s:11MongoKitten9.abstract: The available storage engines in 3.2 or above

Structs/BuildInfo.html#/s:11MongoKitten9.abstract: Creates this from a Document, but throwable

Checks if the left version is older than the right version
Checks if the left version is newer or equal to the right version
Checks if the left version is older or equal to right version

Structs/UpdateError/WriteError.html#/s:1.name: multiple
Structs/UpdateError/WriteError.html#/s:1.abstract: Whether this query was updating multiple Documents

Structs/AggregationOptions.html#/s:11Mon.abstract: The fields to apply to the command document

Structs/AggregationOptions.html.name: AggregationOptions
Structs/AggregationOptions.html.abstract: An option to use for an aggregate operation

Structs/InsertErrors.html.name: InsertErrors
Structs/InsertErrors.html.abstract: An error thrown by an Insert operation when writing fails

Structs/UpdateError.html.name: UpdateError
Structs/UpdateError.html.abstract: An error thrown by an Update operation when writing fails

Structs/RemoveError.html.name: RemoveError

Structs/GeoNearOptions.html.name: GeoNearOptions
Structs/GeoNearOptions.html.abstract: Requires the resulting data to be near the provided point

Structs/QueryFlags.html.name: QueryFlags
Structs/QueryFlags.html.abstract: The flags that can be used in a Find/Query message

Structs/DBRef.html.name: DBRef
Structs/DBRef.html.abstract: DBRef is a structure made to keep references to other MongoDB objects and resolve them easily

Structs/Projection.html.name: Projection
Structs/Projection.html.abstract: A projection removes any keys from it’s input Documents that have not been specified to be included except _id.

Structs/Sort.html.name: Sort
Structs/Sort.html.abstract: A Sort object specifies to MongoDB in what order certain Documents need to be ordered

Structs/ClientSettings.html.name: ClientSettings
Structs/ClientSettings.html.abstract: Various settings to control the behavior of a MongoClient.

Structs/MongoHost.html.name: MongoHost
Structs/MongoHost.html.abstract: The location of a Mongo server - i.e. server name and port number

Structs/MongoCredentials.html.name: MongoCredentials
Structs/MongoCredentials.html.abstract: Represents credentials to authenticate to a mongo server,as well as the source of the credentials and the authentication mechanism to use.

Structs/SSLSettings.html.name: SSLSettings
Structs/SSLSettings.html.abstract: Settings for connecting to MongoDB via SSL.

Protocols/ExpressionRepresentable.html.name: ExpressionRepresentable
Protocols/ExpressionRepresentable.html.abstract: Objects conforming to this are represetnable as an Expression

Enums/SortOrder.html#/s:11MongoKitten9So.name: ascending
Enums/SortOrder.html#/s:11MongoKitten9So.abstract: Ascending means that we order from past to future or from 0 to 10

Enums/AQT/AQTType.html.name: AQTType
Enums/AQT/AQTType.html.abstract: The types we support as raw Int32 values

Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO8doc.abstract: Returns a Document that represents this AQT as a Query/Filter

Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO6typ.name: typeof
Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO6typ.abstract: Whether the type in key is equal to the AQTType https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/operator/query/type/#op._S_type

Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO12va.name: valNotEquals
Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO12va.abstract: The Value within the key does not match this Value

Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO11gr.name: greaterThan
Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO11gr.abstract: Whether the Value within the key is greater than this Value

Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO18gr.name: greaterThanOrEqual
Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO18gr.abstract: Whether the Value within the key is greater than or equal to this Value

Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO11sm.name: smallerThan
Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO11sm.abstract: Whether the Value within the key is smaller than this Value

Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO18sm.name: smallerThanOrEqual
Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO18sm.abstract: Whether the Value within the key is smaller than or equal to this Value

Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO15co.name: containsElement
Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO15co.abstract: Whether a subdocument in the array within the key matches one of the queries/filters

Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO2orA.name: or
Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO2orA.abstract: Whether any of these AQT conditions is correct

Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO3not.name: not
Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO3not.abstract: Whether none of these AQT conditions are correct

Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO7not.name: nothing
Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO7not.abstract: Whether nothing needs to be matched. Is always true and just a placeholder

Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO8con.name: contains
Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO8con.abstract: Whether the String value within the key contains this String.

Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO10st.name: startsWith
Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO10st.abstract: Whether the String value within the key starts with this String.

Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO8end.name: endsWith
Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO8end.abstract: Whether the String value within the key ends with this String.

Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO6exi.name: exists
Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO6exi.abstract: Value at this key exists, even if it is Null

Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO2inA.name: in
Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO2inA.abstract: Value is one of the given values

Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO4nea.name: near
Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO4nea.abstract: Match all documents containing a key with geospatial data that is near the specified GeoJSON Point.

Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO9geo.name: geoWithin
Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO9geo.abstract: Match all documents containing a key with geospatial data that exists entirely within the specified Polygon.

Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO13ge.name: geoIntersects
Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO13ge.abstract: Match all documents containing a key with geospatial data that intersects with the specified shape.

Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO10ne.name: nearSphere
Enums/AQT.html#/s:11MongoKitten3AQTO10ne.abstract: Match all documents containing a key with geospatial data that is near the specified GeoJSON point using spherical geometry.

Enums/AccumulatedGroupExpression.html#/s.name: average
Enums/AccumulatedGroupExpression.html#/s.abstract: The average of multiple expressions (results). When a

Enums/AccumulatedGroupExpression.html#/s.name: first
Enums/AccumulatedGroupExpression.html#/s.abstract: Returns the value that results from applying an expression to the first document in a group of documents.

Enums/AccumulatedGroupExpression.html#/s.name: last
Enums/AccumulatedGroupExpression.html#/s.abstract: Returns the value that results from applying an expression to the last document in a group of documents.

Enums/AccumulatedGroupExpression.html#/s.name: push
Enums/AccumulatedGroupExpression.html#/s.abstract: Returns an array of all values that result from applying an expression to each document in a group of documents that share the same group by key.

Enums/AccumulatedGroupExpression.html#/s.name: addToSet
Enums/AccumulatedGroupExpression.html#/s.abstract: Returns an array of all unique values that results from applying an expression to each document in a group of documents that share the same group by key.

Enums/AccumulatedGroupExpression.html#/s.abstract: Creates a min expression. Can contain one or more values.

Enums/AccumulatedGroupExpression.html#/s.abstract: Creates a max expression. Can contain one or more values.

Enums/AccumulatedGroupExpression.html#/s.name: maxOf(_:)
Enums/AccumulatedGroupExpression.html#/s.abstract: Creates a max expression. Can contain one or more values.

Enums/AccumulatedGroupExpression.html#/s.name: makePrimitive()
Enums/AccumulatedGroupExpression.html#/s.abstract: Converts this AccumulatedGroupExpression to a BSON.Primitive so that it can be embedded inside a Document easily

Enums/AccumulatedGroupExpression.html#/s.name: makeDocument()
Enums/AccumulatedGroupExpression.html#/s.abstract: Converts this AccumulatedGroupExpression to a Document operator for MongoDB

Enums/Expression.html#/s:11MongoKitten10.name: makePrimitive()
Enums/Expression.html#/s:11MongoKitten10.abstract: Converts an expression to a BSON.Primitive for easy embedding in Documents

Enums/IndexParameter/TextIndexVersion.ht.name: makePrimitive()
Enums/IndexParameter/TextIndexVersion.ht.abstract: Converts this TextIndexVersion to something easily embeddable in a Document

Enums/IndexParameter/TextIndexVersion.ht.name: TextIndexVersion
Enums/IndexParameter/TextIndexVersion.ht.abstract: A TextIndexVersion defines to MongoDB what kind of text index should be created.

Enums/IndexParameter.html#/s:11MongoKitt.name: sort
Enums/IndexParameter.html#/s:11MongoKitt.abstract: Sorts the specified field with in the given order

Enums/IndexParameter.html#/s:11MongoKitt.name: sortedCompound
Enums/IndexParameter.html#/s:11MongoKitt.abstract: Sorts the specified fields in the given order. The first specified key is the first key that will be used for sorting.

Enums/IndexParameter.html#/s:11MongoKitt.name: expire
Enums/IndexParameter.html#/s:11MongoKitt.abstract: Removes a Document after it’s been in the database for the provided amount of seconds

Enums/IndexParameter.html#/s:11MongoKitt.name: sparse
Enums/IndexParameter.html#/s:11MongoKitt.abstract: Only indexes a Document when the Document contain the indexed fields, even if it’s Null

Enums/IndexParameter.html#/s:11MongoKitt.name: custom
Enums/IndexParameter.html#/s:11MongoKitt.abstract: A custom index Document for unsupported features.

Enums/IndexParameter.html#/s:11MongoKitt.name: partialFilter
Enums/IndexParameter.html#/s:11MongoKitt.abstract: Partial indexes only index Documents matching certain requirements. Like a user whose age is at least 25 years old. This is done using a provided raw MongoDB Document containing operators

Enums/IndexParameter.html#/s:11MongoKitt.name: buildInBackground
Enums/IndexParameter.html#/s:11MongoKitt.abstract: Builds this index in the background. Useful for applications that have a lot of data

Enums/IndexParameter.html#/s:11MongoKitt.name: text
Enums/IndexParameter.html#/s:11MongoKitt.abstract: Applies text indexing to the provided keys

Enums/ReadConcern.html#/s:11MongoKitten1.name: local
Enums/ReadConcern.html#/s:11MongoKitten1.abstract: The query returns the instance’s most recent data. Provides no guarantee that the data has been written to a majority of the replica set members

Enums/ReadConcern.html#/s:11MongoKitten1.name: majority
Enums/ReadConcern.html#/s:11MongoKitten1.abstract: The query returns the instance’s most recent data acknowledged as having been written to a majority of members in the replica set.

Enums/ReadConcern.html#/s:11MongoKitten1.name: linearizable
Enums/ReadConcern.html#/s:11MongoKitten1.abstract: The query returns data that reflects all successful writes issued with a write concern of majority and acknowledged prior to the start of the read operation.

Enums/WriteConcern.html#/s:11MongoKitten.name: makePrimitive()
Enums/WriteConcern.html#/s:11MongoKitten.abstract: Converts this WriteConcern to a BSON.Primitive for embedding

Enums/AuthenticationError.html#/s:11Mong.name: invalidNonce
Enums/AuthenticationError.html#/s:11Mong.abstract: The nonce received by the server isn’t valid

Enums/AuthenticationError.html#/s:11Mong.name: debugDescription
Enums/AuthenticationError.html#/s:11Mong.abstract: A textual representation of this instance, suitable for debugging.

Enums/MongoError.html#/s:11MongoKitten0A.name: invalidBodyLength
Enums/MongoError.html#/s:11MongoKitten0A.abstract: The body of this message is an invalid length

Enums/MongoError.html#/s:11MongoKitten0A.name: notConnected
Enums/MongoError.html#/s:11MongoKitten0A.abstract: We can’t do this action because we’re not yet connected

Enums/MongoError.html#/s:11MongoKitten0A.name: cursorInitializationError
Enums/MongoError.html#/s:11MongoKitten0A.abstract: Thrown when the initialization of a cursor, on request of the server, failed because of missing data.

Enums/MongoError.html#/s:11MongoKitten0A.name: invalidReply
Enums/MongoError.html#/s:11MongoKitten0A.abstract: The MongoDB server responded with an invalid reply

Enums/MongoError.html#/s:11MongoKitten0A.name: invalidResponse
Enums/MongoError.html#/s:11MongoKitten0A.abstract: The response with the given documents is invalid

Enums/MongoError.html#/s:11MongoKitten0A.name: internalInconsistency
Enums/MongoError.html#/s:11MongoKitten0A.abstract: If you get one of these, it’s probably a bug on our side. Sorry. Please file an issue at https://github.com/OpenKitten/MongoKitten/issues/new :)

Enums/MongoError.html#/s:11MongoKitten0A.name: negativeBytesRequested
Enums/MongoError.html#/s:11MongoKitten0A.abstract: GridFS was asked to return a negative amount of bytes

Enums/MongoError.html#/s:11MongoKitten0A.name: tooMuchDataRequested
Enums/MongoError.html#/s:11MongoKitten0A.abstract: GridFS had a request for data that does not exist

Enums/MongoError.html#/s:11MongoKitten0A.name: negativeDataRequested
Enums/MongoError.html#/s:11MongoKitten0A.abstract: GridFS had a request for data that had a negative index

Enums/MongoError.html#/s:11MongoKitten0A.name: invalidBuildInfoDocument
Enums/MongoError.html#/s:11MongoKitten0A.abstract: The received Document that contains the MongoDB server build info is invalid

Enums/MongoError.html#/s:11MongoKitten0A.name: debugDescription
Enums/MongoError.html#/s:11MongoKitten0A.abstract: A textual representation of this instance, suitable for debugging.

Enums/WriteConcern.html.name: WriteConcern
Enums/WriteConcern.html.abstract: A WriteConcern describes the requested level of acknowledgement for a Write operation such as delete, update or insert.

Enums/ReadConcern.html.name: ReadConcern
Enums/ReadConcern.html.abstract: Used for sharded clusers and replica sets.

Enums/IndexParameter.html.name: IndexParameter
Enums/IndexParameter.html.abstract: The options to apply to the creation of an index.

Enums/Expression.html.name: Expression
Enums/Expression.html.abstract: The expressions are currently only supporting literals.

Enums/AccumulatedGroupExpression.html.name: AccumulatedGroupExpression
Enums/AccumulatedGroupExpression.html.abstract: All Accumulated Group Expressions used for the group aggregation stage

Enums/SortOrder.html.name: SortOrder
Enums/SortOrder.html.abstract: Defines the order in which a field has to be sorted

Enums/AuthenticationMechanism.html.name: AuthenticationMechanism
Enums/AuthenticationMechanism.html.abstract: An enumeration of the MongodDB-supported authentication mechanisms.

Classes/Collection.html#/s:11MongoKitten.abstract: Remove the index specified

Classes/Collection.html#/s:11MongoKitten.name: listIndexes()
Classes/Collection.html#/s:11MongoKitten.abstract: Lists all indexes for this collection as Documents

Classes/Collection.html#/s:11MongoKitten.name: set(flags:)
Classes/Collection.html#/s:11MongoKitten.abstract: Modifies the collection. Requires access to collMod

Classes/Collection.html#/s:11MongoKitten.name: aggregate(_:readConcern:collation:options:)
Classes/Collection.html#/s:11MongoKitten.abstract: Uses the aggregation pipeline to process documents into aggregated results.

Classes/Collection.html#/s:11MongoKitten.name: aggregate(_:readConcern:collation:options:)
Classes/Collection.html#/s:11MongoKitten.abstract: Uses the aggregation pipeline to process documents into aggregated results.

Classes/Collection.html#/s:11MongoKitten.name: touch(data:index:)
Classes/Collection.html#/s:11MongoKitten.abstract: The touch command loads data from the data storage layer into memory.

Classes/Collection.html#/s:11MongoKitten.name: convertToCapped(cappingAt:)
Classes/Collection.html#/s:11MongoKitten.abstract: Makes the collection capped, meaning it can only contain <cap> amount of Documents

Classes/Collection.html#/s:11MongoKitten.name: rebuildIndexes()
Classes/Collection.html#/s:11MongoKitten.abstract: Tells the MongoDB server to re-index this collection

Classes/Collection.html#/s:11MongoKitten.name: compact(forced:)
Classes/Collection.html#/s:11MongoKitten.abstract: Tells the MongoDB server to make this collection more compact, optimizing disk storage space

Classes/Collection.html#/s:11MongoKitten.name: cloneToCappedCollection(named:capped:)
Classes/Collection.html#/s:11MongoKitten.abstract: Clones this collection to another place and caps it

Classes/Collection.html#/s:11MongoKitten.name: geoNear(options:readConcern:)
Classes/Collection.html#/s:11MongoKitten.abstract: Returns documents in order of proximity to a specified point, from the nearest to farthest. geoNear requires a geospatial index.

Classes/Collection.html#/s:11MongoKitten.name: description
Classes/Collection.html#/s:11MongoKitten.abstract: Used for debugging

Classes/Collection.html#/s:11MongoKitten.name: createIndex(named:withParameters:)
Classes/Collection.html#/s:11MongoKitten.abstract: Creates an Index in this Collection on the specified keys.

Classes/Collection.html#/s:11MongoKitten.name: createIndexes(_:)
Classes/Collection.html#/s:11MongoKitten.abstract: Creates multiple indexes as specified

Classes/Database.html.name: Database
Classes/Database.html.abstract: A Mongo Database. Cannot be publically initialized.

Classes/Cursor.html.name: Cursor
Classes/Cursor.html.abstract: A Cursor is a pointer to a sequence/collection of Documents on the MongoDB server.

Classes/GridFS.html.name: GridFS
Classes/GridFS.html.abstract: A GridFS instance similar to a collection

Classes/Server.html.name: Server
Classes/Server.html.abstract: A server object is the core of MongoKitten as it’s used to communicate to the server.
